name: Ashton Kutcher
religion: Kutcher was raised Catholic, but calls himslef "spiritual" while apparently studying Kabbalah.
politicalViews: Kutcher is all over the map, calling himself "fiscally conservative" and "socially liberal."
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Ashton Kutcher was born and raised in Ceder Rapids, Iowa in a Roman Catholic family.
Kutcher doesn't seem too keen on organized religion, however, and taking the classic celebrity "spirituality" route, he has said:

Spirituality is doing things and then seeing the results and then believing in them. I don't know that I've specifically changed that like, 'Oh, let me kneel four times and say this phrase 20 times and now my life will be better.' I don't buy that at all.

content.sourceTitle: Ashton Kutcher And Demi Moore Decide To Be Religious So People Don't Think They've Split Up, Which Is Handy
content.text: In the midst of divorce rumors with his wife, Demi Moore, Kutcher came out in support of celebrity Judaism, Kabbalah. The media speculated that it was a tactic to divert attention from his flailing marriage. Still, Kutcher and Moore went as far as to take a pilgrimage to Israel and were seen at the celebrity hang-out, The Kabbalah Center in Los Angeles.

content.sourceTitle: Ashton Kutcher: Kabbalah Makes People Positive
content.text: I find the study of Jewish mysticism to be really interesting and a completely different world I never even knew existedâ€¦The meetings really set you on a positive path for the rest of the week.

content.sourceTitle: Hollywood Liberal Ashton Kutcher: I'm Going Conservative in the Clutch
content.text: Politically, Kutcher isn't so quick to jump on the Hollywood bandwagon. He's definitely said some very liberal things, such as blaming offshore oil spills on the "Republican National Drill."

content.sourceTitle: Ashton Kutcher, Demi Moore latest celebs for Obama

content.text: but doesn't seem to support his healthcare plan, or universal healthcare in general, saying:

content.sourceTitle: Ashton Kutcher Comes Out of the Closet on 'Real Time.'
content.text: Frankly, I don't want to pay for the guy who's getting a triple-bypass because he's eating fast food all day and deep-fried snickers bars. I don't want to pay for him! Whether he's wealthy or he's not!
Wow, that's a very Republican, maybe even a libertarian, thing to say.
Back to liberalism: Kutcher has been a big supporter of gay rights and gay marriage, Tweeting support for his home state of Iowa for legalizing gay marriage and saying things like:

content.sourceTitle: Ashton Kutcher on gay marriage ruling in Iowa
content.text: I have many gay friends and think they deserve equal rights.

content.sourceTitle: Hollywood Liberal Ashton Kutcher: I'm Going Conservative in the Clutch
content.text: Then Kutcher turns around and, in classic conservative paranoia, discusses America's impending collapse and the need to be prepared with martial arts training and a missile defense program.
How does he explain it? In his own words:

content.sourceTitle: Ashton Kutcher Comes Out of the Closet on 'Real Time.'
content.text: I am a fiscally conservative, socially liberal independent.
